result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel A. Peterson

records.addlTxt: 1:58 PM Defendant Gabriel A. Peterson in court.  Attorney Jonathan Evans Barnett in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. was present in court when date set.  State request warrant forfeit bond.  Court authorize bench warrant and forfeits bond pending hearing. CC will not schedule for bond forfeiture no cash posted.
No practice of law until license reinstated.

1:58 PM Defendant Gabriel A. Peterson in court.  Attorney Jonathan Evans Barnett in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is uncertain if wants an attorney and would like to talk to ADA.  State would like a waiver of an attorney. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Court orders $500 Signature bond and no practice of law until license reinstated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Oath and Consent to Serve as Special Prosecutor
